job_title: Commnunity Mental Health Worker in Whitby, ON
pros:
Reasonable pay with benefits and pension. Vacation starts from 3 weeks with paid mental health days. You can also get a paid leave for your birthday. Clients you work with are great! Great place for new grads to develop skills and knowledge in mental health field.

For clients and the chance to work in mental health field, I give 5 stars! I took away 1 start due to the management.
cons: Management was not very supportive when you had too much caseload. They just tell you it's your time management issues. Not much funding for professional development. They offer regular training, but it's too easy for people who were well-trained before.

pros: You may get $12-$20 per hour minus deductions including Union dues for a Union that does not support you. And you may be required to work alone quite often.
cons: Not allowed to request time off more than once a month and it is at the discretion of a supervisor who does not care about what may be going on in your life or what your goals are. Pay is equivalent to working at Mc Donald's or Canadian Tire. Management makes all the decisions and do not allow you to call in sick, if you do, even for one day, you will be required to provide a sick mote and they treat you differently, or threaten to let you go.

pros: Good pay, pension plan, good management
cons: Human Resources Department very rude to employees/ no understanding of mental health in the workplace. Few opportunities for advancement.
